【31† Sometimes, the aftermath is more devastating than the storm. That is the story of the 2008 financial crisis. It was disastrous at the time, but what has been worse is how long it has lingered. 】 【32†Chrystia Freeland】 

 【33† What we know about the global financial crisis is that we don't know very much. 】 【34†Paul Samuelson】 

 【35† I bet taxpayers remember providing more than $812 billion to Citigroup and Bank of America, two Wall Street banks, in 2009 to bail them out during the 2008 financial crisis. Taxpayers remember that generosity; big banks evidently don't. 】 【36†John Kennedy】 

 【37† Food Stamp recipients didn't cause the financial crisis; recklessness on Wall Street did. 】 【38†Barack Obama】 

 【39† The financial crisis should not become an excuse to raise taxes, which would only undermine the economic growth required to regain our strength. 】 【40†George W. Bush】 

 【41† There has been a banking crisis, a financial crisis, an economic crisis, a social crisis, a geostrategic crisis and an environmental crisis. That's considerable in a country that's used to being protected. 】 【42†Jean-Francois Cope】 

 【43† A financial crisis is a great time for professional investors and a horrible time for average ones. 】 【44†Robert Kiyosaki】 

 【45† The Global Financial Crisis and Great Recession posed daunting new challenges for central banks around the world and spurred innovations in the design, implementation, and communication of monetary policy. 】 【46†Janet Yellen】 

 【47† I believe that the financial crisis of 2008/9 exposed more a lack of ethics and morality - especially by the financial sector - rather than a problem of regulation or criminality. There were, of course, regulatory lessons to be learned, but at heart, there was a collective loss of our moral compass. 】 【48†Paul Polman】 

 【49† The financial crisis is a stark reminder that transparency and disclosure are essential in today's marketplace. 】 【50†Jack Reed】 

 【51† Just as the financial crisis has created toxic assets and 'zombie' financial institutions, so has it transformed conservatism into a movement of the living dead. 】 【52†Thomas Frank】 

 【53† This is an anxiety driven world - the whole world is driven by anxiety. It is anxiety about the aftermath of the global financial crisis; it's anxiety about inequality and about computers replacing jobs. 】 【54†Robert J. Shiller】 

 【55† No one should have to choose between medicine and other necessities. No one should have to use the emergency room every time a child gets sick. And no one should have to live in constant fear that a medical problem will become a financial crisis. 】 【56†Brad Henry】 

 【57† Asean is obviously a very important association for us. Over the past 30 years Asean has made great strides in regional cooperation covering a number of areas, although recently it has been under strain because of the financial crisis and other challenges. 】 【58†Hassanal Bolkiah】 

 【59† There is no question that the recovery from the global recession triggered by the 2008 financial crisis has been unusually lengthy and anemic. 】 【60†Michael Spence】 

 【61† The motto of the old order in the City of London was, 'My word is my bond,' but the financial crisis revealed a culture quite alien to that heritage. The stewards of people's money were revealed to have been speculators with it. 】 【62†Gordon Brown】 

 【63† The financial crisis of 2008 was not caused by investment banks betting against the housing market in 2007. It was caused by the fact that too few investors - including all of the big investment banks - bet too heavily on the housing market in the years before 2007. 】 【64†James Surowiecki】 

 【65† The financial crisis involved significant failures in the functioning, regulation, and supervision of OTC derivatives markets. 】 【66†Jerome Powell】 

 【67† The global financial crisis - missed by most analysts - shows that most forecasters are poor at pricing in economic/financial risks, let alone geopolitical ones. 】 【68†Nouriel Roubini】 

 【69† Washington's answer to a self-inflicted financial crisis reminded Americans why they so deeply distrust the political class. The 'fiscal cliff' process was secretive and sloppy, and the nation's so-called leadership lacked the political courage to address our root problems: joblessness and debt. 】 【70†Ron Fournier】 

 【71† There are downsides to implicitly trusting banks, as the 2008 financial crisis showed. 】 【72†Balaji Srinivasan】 

【73† 】 

【73† Not every business cycle has a financial crisis. Frequently they do. 】 【74†Kenneth Arrow】 

 【75† The financial crisis of 2008-09 was in large part the result of the so-called 'success' of people who did not understand their fiduciary duty. This kind of 'success' is extremely harmful to all of society. 】 【76†Li Lu】

parts:
Here are some quotes reflecting on the 2008 financial crisis:

1. Chrystia Freeland remarked on the lingering impact: "Sometimes, the aftermath is more devastating than the storm. That is the story of the 2008 financial crisis. It was disastrous at the time, but what has been worse is how long it has lingered"【22†source】.

2. Paul Samuelson highlighted the complexity and unknowns of the crisis: "What we know about the global financial crisis is that we don't know very much"【22†source】.

3. Barack Obama pointed to the root causes: "Food Stamp recipients didn't cause the financial crisis; recklessness on Wall Street did"【22†source】.

These reflections underscore the multifaceted nature of the crisis and its long-term effects on society and the economy.

parts: please provide more

Certainly, here are additional quotes on the 2008 financial crisis:

4. John Kennedy stressed the public's memory of the bailouts: "I bet taxpayers remember providing more than $812 billion to Citigroup and Bank of America, two Wall Street banks, in 2009 to bail them out during the 2008 financial crisis. Taxpayers remember that generosity; big banks evidently don't"【22†source】.

5. George W. Bush cautioned against using the crisis as a pretext to increase taxes: "The financial crisis should not become an excuse to raise taxes, which would only undermine the economic growth required to regain our strength"【22†source】.

6. Paul Polman suggested the crisis revealed a moral deficit: "I believe that the financial crisis of 2008/9 exposed more a lack of ethics and morality - especially by the financial sector - rather than a problem of regulation or criminality"【22†source】.

7. Michael Spence talked about the prolonged recovery: "There is no question that the recovery from the global recession triggered by the 2008 financial crisis has been unusually lengthy and anemic"【22†source】.

These insights provide a range of perspectives, from criticism of financial institutions and regulatory frameworks to reflections on the broader economic and moral implications of the crisis.

There were, of course, regulatory lessons to be learned, but at heart, there was a collective loss of our moral compass. 】 【48†Paul Polman】 

 【49† The financial crisis is a stark reminder that transparency and disclosure are essential in today's marketplace. 】 【50†Jack Reed】 

 【51† Just as the financial crisis has created toxic assets and 'zombie' financial institutions, so has it transformed conservatism into a movement of the living dead. 】 【52†Thomas Frank】 

 【53† This is an anxiety driven world - the whole world is driven by anxiety. It is anxiety about the aftermath of the global financial crisis; it's anxiety about inequality and about computers replacing jobs. 】 【54†Robert J. Shiller】 

 【55† No one should have to choose between medicine and other necessities. No one should have to use the emergency room every time a child gets sick. And no one should have to live in constant fear that a medical problem will become a financial crisis. 】 【56†Brad Henry】

 【59† There is no question that the recovery from the global recession triggered by the 2008 financial crisis has been unusually lengthy and anemic. 】 【60†Michael Spence】

 【69† Washington's answer to a self-inflicted financial crisis reminded Americans why they so deeply distrust the political class. The 'fiscal cliff' process was secretive and sloppy, and the nation's so-called leadership lacked the political courage to address our root problems: joblessness and debt. 】 【70†Ron Fournier】 

 【71† There are downsides to implicitly trusting banks, as the 2008 financial crisis showed. 】 【72†Balaji Srinivasan】 

【73† 】

 【75† The financial crisis of 2008-09 was in large part the result of the so-called 'success' of people who did not understand their fiduciary duty. This kind of 'success' is extremely harmful to all of society. 】 【76†Li Lu】

I take my hand off and then the whole world gets really f***in' fair really f***in' quickly and nobody actually wants that. They say they do but they don't. They want what we have to give them but they also wanna, you know, play innocent and pretend they have no idea where it came from. Well, that's more hypocrisy than I'm willing to swallow, so f*** 'em. F*** normal people. You know, the funny thing is, tomorrow if all of this goes tits up they're gonna crucify us for being too reckless but if we're wrong, and everything gets back on track? L49: # Margin Call
L50: 
L51: Margin Call is a 2011 film that follows the key people at an investment bank, over a 24-hour period, during the early stages of the financial crisis.   
L52: 
L53: Genre: Drama, Thriller
L54:

L82: Will Emerson: Jesus, Seth. Listen, if you really wanna do this with your life you have to believe you're necessary and you are. People wanna live like this with their cars and big f***in' houses they can't even pay for, then you're necessary. The only reason they all get to continue living like kings is because we got our fingers on the scales in their favor. I take my hand off and then the whole world gets really f***in' fair really f***in' quickly and nobody actually wants that. They say they do but they don't. They want what we have to give them but they also wanna, you know, play innocent and pretend they have no idea where it came from. Well, that's more hypocrisy than I'm willing to swallow, so f*** 'em. F*** normal people. You know, the funny thing is, tomorrow if all of this goes tits up they're gonna crucify us for being too reckless but if we're wrong, and everything gets back on track? Well then, the same people are gonna laugh till they piss their pants cause we're gonna all look like the biggest pussies God ever let through the door.

Pieces of paper with pictures on it so we don't have to kill each other just to get something to eat. It's not wrong. It's all just the same thing over and over; we can't help ourselves. And you and I can't control it, or stop it, or even slow it, or even ever-so-slightly alter it. We just react. And we make a lot money if we get it right. And we get left by the side of the road if we get it wrong. And there have always been and there always will be the same percentage of winners and losers, happy f***ers and sad suckers, fat cats and starving dogs in this world. Yeah, there may be more of us today than there's ever been. But the percentages-they stay exactly the same.

parts:
Here are some memorable quotes from the movie "Margin Call":

1. Will Emerson: "People wanna live like this with their cars and big f***in' houses they can't even pay for, then you're necessary... if all of this goes tits up they're gonna crucify us for being too reckless but if we're wrong, and everything gets back on track?... they're gonna laugh till they piss their pants"【36†source】.

2. John Tuld: "There are three ways to make a living in this business: be first, be smarter, or cheat"【36†source】.

3. Sam Rogers: "Who are we selling this to?... And you're selling something that you know has no value"【36†source】.

These lines encapsulate the tension and moral ambiguity that the characters in the film grapple with during the early stages of the financial crisis.

Here are some quotes about difficult journeys:

2. Oliver Goldsmith: "Life is a journey that must be traveled no matter how bad the roads and accommodations"【74†source】.

3. Laozi: "Do the difficult things while they are easy and do the great things while they are small. A journey of a thousand miles must begin with a single step"【74†source】.

4. Joyce Meyer: "Being negative only makes a difficult journey more difficult. You may be given a cactus, but you don't have to sit on it"【75†source】.

5. Nicholas Sparks: "The most difficult journeys often take us where we were meant to go"【78†source】.

These quotes reflect the various perspectives on facing and overcoming the challenges inherent in difficult journeys.

parts:
Here are some quotes about teaching and learning from one another:

1. John Quincy Adams: "If your actions inspire others to dream more, learn more, do more and become more, you are a leader"【100†source】.

2. Margaret Fuller: "If you have knowledge, let others light their candles in it"【101†source】.

3. Douglas Adams: "Human beings, who are almost unique in having the ability to learn from the experience of others, are also remarkable for their apparent disinclination to do so"【102†source】.

4. Marian Wright Edelman: "Education is for improving the lives of others and for leaving your community and world better than you found it"【103†source】.

5. William Arthur Ward: "The mediocre teacher tells. The good teacher explains. The superior teacher demonstrates. The great teacher inspires"【105†source】.

These quotes reflect the significance of sharing knowledge, the unique human capacity to learn from others, and the profound impact of education and inspiration on society.

metadata_list.text: 16. ‘The mediocre teacher tells. The good teacher explains. The superior teacher demonstrates. The great teacher inspires.’ ― William Arthur Ward

parts:
Here are quotes that reflect on the reciprocal learning that occurs in teaching:

1. Robert Heinlein beautifully encapsulates this idea: "When one teaches, two learn"【121†source】.

2. William Arthur Ward emphasizes the transformative power of teaching: "The mediocre teacher tells. The good teacher explains. The superior teacher demonstrates. The great teacher inspires"【122†source】.

These quotes highlight the dual nature of teaching, suggesting that educators not only impart knowledge but also gain insights and learn alongside their students.

5. ‘I never teach my pupils; I only attempt to provide the conditions in which they can learn.’ –Albert Einstein
L73: 
L74: 6. ‘Teaching is the highest form of understanding.’ –Aristotle
L75: 
L76: 7. ‘When one teaches, two learn.’ –Robert Heinlein
L77: 
L78: See also Inspirational Quotes About Life
L79: 
L80: 8. ‘A teacher affects eternity: he can never tell where his influence stops.’ –Henry Adams
L81: 
L82: 9. ‘I cannot teach anybody anything, I can only make them think.’ –Socrates
L83: 
L84: 10. ‘Those who know, do. Those that understand, teach.’ –Aristotle
L85: 
L86: 11. ‘Teachers teach someone something, in that order.’ –Samuel Natale
L87:

L89:

L91: 
L92: 14. ‘The true teacher defends his pupils against his own personal influence.’ –Amos Bronson Alcott
L93: 
L94: 15. ‘In a completely rational society, the best of us would be teachers and the rest of us would have to settle for something else.’ –Lee Iacocca
L95:

L97: 
L98: 16. ‘The mediocre teacher tells. The good teacher explains. The superior teacher demonstrates. The great teacher inspires.’ ― William Arthur Ward
L99:

L101:

L107:

L109:

L111: 
L112: 23. ‘Teaching is the one profession that creates all other professions.’ —Unknown

L121:

L123: 
L124: 29. ‘The word ‘education’ comes from the root e from ex, out, and duco, I lead. It means a leading out. To me education is a leading out of what is already there in the pupil’s soul.’ –Muriel Spark

parts:
Here are additional quotes that speak to the concept of learning from those you are teaching:

1. Socrates emphasized the facilitative role of the teacher: "I cannot teach anybody anything, I can only make them think"【128†source】.

2. Mustafa Kemal Atatürk metaphorically described the self-sacrificing nature of good teachers: "A good teacher is like a candle – it consumes itself to light the way for others"【129†source】.

3. Paulo Coelho on the self-driven nature of learning: "Teaching is only demonstrating that it is possible. Learning is making it possible for yourself"【130†source】.

4. Scott Hayden highlights the reciprocal love involved in teaching and learning: "Teachers have three loves: love of learning, love of learners, and the love of bringing the first two loves together"【131†source】.

5. Thomas Carruthers and William Butler Yeats reflect on the transformative effect of teaching: "A good teacher is one who makes himself progressively unnecessary... Education is not the filling of a pail, but the lighting of a fire"【132†source】.

These quotes underscore the mutual enrichment that characterizes the teaching-learning relationship.
